metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9217 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
systemd-resolved through 233 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (daemon crash) via a crafted DNS response with an empty questionsection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gudev-1.0 - 1:204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
libgudev-1.0-0 - 1:204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
libpam-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
libsystemd-daemon0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
libsystemd-id128-0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
libsystemd-journal0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
libsystemd-login0 - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
libudev1 - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
python-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
systemd-services - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
udev - 204-5ubuntu20.31+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: systemd package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '204-5ubuntu20.24').
